prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom** **Step 1: Create the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. This sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) which contains two lines (line\\_1 and line\\_2) and two arcs (arc\\_1 and arc\\_2). - The first line (line\\_1) starts at (0.0, 0.0) and ends at (0.0135, 0.0). - The first arc (arc\\_1) starts at (0.0135, 0.0), has a midpoint at (0.0512, 0.0727), and ends at (0.089, 0.0). - The second line (line\\_2) starts at (0.089, 0.0) and ends at (0.1025, 0.0). - The second arc (arc\\_2) starts at (0.1025, 0.0), has a midpoint at (0.0512, 0.0842), and ends at (0.0, 0.0). **Step 3: Scale the Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1025. This scaling operation will be applied to every point in the sketch. **Step 4: Extrude the Sketch** Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by a depth of 0.75 units. The opposite normal extrusion depth is 0.0 units. This will create a 3D solid. The resulting part is a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. It has a smooth surface and appears to be a solid, opaque material. The object is centered and occupies a significant portion of the image. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.1025, 0.75, and 0.1025 units respectively.</description>

For the final CAD model, the described part will be used as the base, and additional parts will be built upon it using the operations defined for those parts in the CAD Assembly JSON. The final shape will have a height of approximately 1.25 (0.45 for part 1 + 0.45 for part 2 + 0.35 for part 3). You may now proceed with creating the next part using the same guidelines as above, clearly stating the shape and dimensions being constructed and providing detailed step-by-step instructions for each part based on the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>
